section.title: Introduction
section.para: OpenID is an authentication mechanism where the identity of the user is maintained by trusted external providers. This takes the burden in maintaining ans securing passwords for users off of the eXist database and on to the Identity Provider (IdP).

section.title: Glossary
section.para: This is a glossary of terms associated with OpenID.

glossentry.glossdef: An IdP that provides an OpenID authentication service on which a Relying Party (an eXist application for these purposes) relies for an assertion.

section.title: Building from Source
section.para: By default, the OpenID service is not built and thus is also not enabled. To recompile the source with OpenID enabled, edit local.build.properties in the extensions directory and change the include.feature.security.openid property from false to true. Then recompile.

example.title: extensions/local.build.properties
example.programlisting: #Security OpenID extensions for eXist include.feature.security.openid = true

section.title: Enabling the Service
section.para: This service is enabled by building the feature from source as described above.

section.title: Disabling the Service
section.para: The only way to disable this service once it is enabled is to remove the lib/extensions/exist-security-openid.jar file.

section.title: Managing
section.para: The out of the box operation for OpenID does not persist the user. To manage the persistence of the user, an XQuery script needs to be called. The Java property org.exist.security.openid.verify_logging_script needs to be set through the setting of the JAVA_OPTIONS system attribute.
The value /db/cms/apps/authentication/util/register.xq is an example of a path name to an XQuery script within the eXist database.
